means: 切断( disconnect的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She ran back to the phone. The line was disconnected.
sentence.Network_cn: 她跑回去接电话。但电话已挂了。

sentence.Network_en: He disconnected the IV bottle from the overhead hook.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把静脉滴注瓶从头顶的钩子上拿下来。

sentence.Network_en: His ability to absorb bits of disconnected information was astonishing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他吸收利用互不相关的零碎信息的能耐惊人。

entry.tran: 分离的;断开的;无关联的
entry.def: Disconnected things are not linked in any way.

example.tran: 一连串毫不相干的事件

example.ex: His ability to absorb bits of disconnected information was astonishing.
example.tran: 他吸收利用互不相关的零碎信息的能耐惊人。

means.word_mean: 1. marked by or composed of disconnected parts or sounds; cut short crisply;
2. having been divided; having the unity destroyed;

sentences.sentence: "Congress...gave the impression of...a confusing sum of disconnected local forces"-Samuel Lubell

means.word_mean: 3. marked by sudden changes in subject and sharp transitions;
4. not plugged in or connected to a power source;

sentences.sentence: "a confused dream about the end of the world"
